questions.question: Which NumPy function calculates the sine of each element in an array?

options.A: numpy.cos()
options.B: numpy.tan()

questions.question: What does the NumPy function `numpy.exp()` do?

options.A: Calculates the exponential of each element in the array.
options.B: Calculates the natural logarithm of each element.
options.C: Calculates the square root of each element.
options.D: Calculates the power of each element to a specified base.

questions.question: Which NumPy function calculates the natural logarithm (base e) of each element in an array?

options.A: numpy.log10()
options.B: numpy.log2()

questions.question: What is the purpose of `numpy.sqrt()`?

options.A: Calculates the square of each element.
options.B: Calculates the cube root of each element.
options.C: Calculates the square root of each element.
options.D: Calculates the logarithm base 2 of each element.

questions.question: Which NumPy function calculates the absolute value of each element in an array?

options.A: numpy.abs()
options.B: numpy.fabs()

questions.question: What does `numpy.floor()` do to each element of a NumPy array?

options.A: Rounds each element to the nearest integer.
options.B: Rounds each element up to the nearest integer.
options.C: Rounds each element down to the nearest integer.
options.D: Truncates the decimal part of each element.

questions.question: Which NumPy function rounds each element of an array to the nearest integer?

options.A: numpy.ceil()
options.B: numpy.floor()

questions.question: What is the purpose of `numpy.ceil()`?

options.A: Rounds each element to the nearest integer.
options.B: Rounds each element up to the nearest integer.
options.C: Rounds each element down to the nearest integer.
options.D: Truncates the decimal part of each element.

questions.question: Which NumPy function truncates the decimal part of each element in an array?

options.A: numpy.round()
options.B: numpy.floor()

questions.question: What does `numpy.power(arr, exponent)` calculate?

options.A: The product of all elements in `arr` raised to the power of `exponent`.
options.B: Each element in `arr` raised to the power of `exponent`.
options.C: The `exponent`-th root of each element in `arr`.
options.D: The sum of each element in `arr` raised to the power of `exponent`.

questions.question: Which NumPy function calculates the tangent of each element in an array?

options.A: numpy.sin()
options.B: numpy.cos()

questions.question: What is the purpose of `numpy.arctan()`?

options.A: Calculates the hyperbolic tangent of each element.
options.B: Calculates the inverse tangent (arc tangent) of each element.
options.C: Calculates the tangent of each element.
options.D: Calculates the angle whose sine is the given number.

questions.question: Which NumPy function calculates the dot product of two arrays?

options.A: numpy.multiply()
options.B: numpy.cross()

questions.question: What does `numpy.cross(a, b)` calculate?

options.A: The element-wise product of arrays `a` and `b`.
options.B: The dot product of arrays `a` and `b`.
options.C: The cross product of arrays `a` and `b`.
options.D: The outer product of arrays `a` and `b`.

questions.question: Which NumPy function performs matrix multiplication of two arrays?

options.A: numpy.dot()
options.B: numpy.multiply()

questions.question: What does `numpy.linalg.norm(arr)` calculate by default?

options.A: The sum of the elements in `arr`.
options.B: The mean of the elements in `arr`.
options.C: The L2 norm (Euclidean norm) of the array.
options.D: The maximum absolute value of the elements in `arr`.

questions.question: Which NumPy function calculates the exponential of all elements in the input array?

options.A: numpy.log()
options.B: numpy.power()

questions.question: What does `numpy.log10()` calculate?

options.A: The natural logarithm of each element.
options.B: The logarithm base 2 of each element.
options.C: The logarithm base 10 of each element.
options.D: The exponential of each element with base 10.

questions.question: Which NumPy function calculates the element-wise remainder of division?

options.A: numpy.divide()
options.B: numpy.floor_divide()

questions.question: What does `numpy.arctan2(y, x)` calculate?

options.A: The element-wise inverse tangent of `y/x`, choosing the quadrant correctly.
options.B: The element-wise inverse tangent of `y/x`, always returning values in [-pi/2, pi/2].
